issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: When using a non-string value like an object, the app crashes. This is a regression from moving to TitaniumKit and was caused by using the {{UIAlertController}} in the {{AlertCallback}} method directly instead of the {{TiUiAlertDialog}} proxy.
fields.summary: iOS: Using a non-string value in alert() causes app to crash in SDK 8.0.0+

comments.body:
FR passed.
The computed alert message is converted to string and then displayed in alert. No app crash or issues with message shown in alert noticed.
Verified on:
Mac OS:10.14.3
Ti SDK: 8.1.0.v20190523110359
Appc CLI: 7.0.11
XCode: 10.2.1

Verified the fix on SDK 8.1.0.v20190606063903 and 8.2.0.v20190606063615 .NO crashing on showing alert .works as expected
{code}
 Name                        = Mac OS X
  Version                     = 10.13.6
  Architecture                = 64bit

Node.js

Titanium SDK
